subject: Sleep
title: The Eight-Hour Sleep Movement
description: Learn The Eight-Hour Sleep Movement in one minute.

hook.text: Eight hours for work, eight hours for rest, eight hours for what we will. This slogan changed the modern world.

buildup.text: Labor activist Robert Owen coined this motto in 1817, demanding limits on the brutal work hours of the era.

discovery.text: The eight-hour workday movement implicitly created the eight-hour sleep norm that we still follow today.

twist.text: The eight-hour sleep recommendation has no basis in biology. It emerged from a labor rights slogan.

climax.text: Despite its origin, eight hours happens to align closely with what sleep science now recommends for most adults.

punchline.text: A factory protest accidentally got the sleep number right.

quiz.question: Where did the eight-hour sleep norm originate?
